summary: This document is an email chain from May 2020 between a federal prosecutor and a law firm partner regarding a follow-up interview with a victim/witness in the Epstein/Maxwell investigation. The chain includes earlier emails from January 2020 discussing the witness's journal entries from 1995-1996 that detail her experiences with Jeffrey Epstein and Ghislaine Maxwell, which she provided to assist the investigation.

persons.name: Sigrid McCawley
persons.role: Partner at Boies Schiller Flexner LLP
persons.context: Attorney representing a witness/victim in the Epstein/Maxwell investigation, coordinating with prosecutors regarding witness interviews and document production.

events.title: Witness's first journal entry
events.description: The witness's first journal entry from December 1995, written in fading colored pencil, referencing her experiences.

events.title: Witness's New York trip and visit to Epstein's house
events.description: Journal entry describes highlights of a New York trip and going to Jeffrey Epstein's house.

events.title: Witness goes to movies with Epstein
events.description: Journal entry describes going to the movies with Jeffrey Epstein.

events.title: Confirmation of journal timeline and travel
events.description: Attorney confirms the witness's last journal entry was in late February and she traveled to New Mexico in April (year context suggests 1996).

events.title: Scheduling follow-up witness interview
events.description: Prosecutors request a follow-up interview with the witness to go through her experiences again and follow up on specific aspects of her recollection, to be conducted via phone.

keyFacts: A witness/victim provided her personal journal entries from 1995-1996 to federal prosecutors, which detail her experiences with Jeffrey Epstein and Ghislaine Maxwell, including visiting Epstein's house and going to the movies with him.
The prosecutors in the Southern District of New York were actively investigating Epstein/Maxwell as of early 2020, conducting witness interviews and requesting documentary evidence.
The law firm Boies Schiller Flexner LLP represented the witness, with partner Sigrid McCawley acting as the point of contact for the prosecution.
The witness's journal entries were described as helpful to refresh her recollection and were considered very helpful to the investigation.
Prosecutors planned a follow-up interview with the witness in May 2020 to review her experiences again, noting they had no doubts about her candor and truthfulness from the previous interview.
